facts.fact_1: There is no vaccine for the new coronavirus right now. Scientists have already begun working on one, but developing a vaccine that is safe and effective in human beings will take many months.

facts.fact_2: Wash your hands frequently and thoroughly, using soap and hot water.Avoiding close contact with people who are sick, sneezing or coughing.

facts.fact_3: Viruses can change over time. Occasionally, a disease outbreak happens when a virus that is common in an animal such as a pig, bat or bird undergoes changes and passes to humans. This is likely how the new coronavirus came to be.

facts.fact_4: Researchers are studying the new coronavirus to learn more about how it infects people. As of this writing, scientists note that most viruses like this one do not stay alive for very long on surfaces, so it is not likely you would get COVID-19 from a package that was in transit for days or weeks.

facts.fact_5: Certain models of professional, tight-fitting respirators (such as the N95) can protect health care workers as they care for infected patients.People with a respiratory illness can wear these masks to lessen their chance of infecting others.

facts.fact_6: Symptons of Covid19 make take upto fourteen days to appear.
